steps.title: Pour the flour into a medium sized bowl.
steps.content: Pour the flour into a medium sized bowl.

steps.title: Put the sugar into the bowl with the flour.
steps.content: Put the sugar into the bowl with the flour.

steps.title: Pour the water into the bowl.
steps.content: Pour the water into the bowl. Do this carefully to make sure the sugar and flour don't spill.

steps.title: Stir the flour, sugar, and water together.
steps.content: Stir the flour, sugar, and water together. Until it all looks soft and smooth. Avoid stirring for too long, the mixture will become heavy.

steps.title: Put the pan on the stove.
steps.content: Put the pan on the stove. Set the stove to medium heat and wait until the pan starts to heat up. [1] X Research source Add margarine to the pan (if desired) to stop the pancake batter from sticking. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Pour some of the batter onto the pan.
steps.content: Pour some of the batter onto the pan. Try to make it look like a circular or oval-like shape. Wait for 1-2 minutes for it to cook. Using a squeeze bottle to dispense batter into the pan is an easy way to get nicely shaped, uniform pancakes. You can even use an empty ketchup bottle to this effect, just clean it carefully first! You will know that it is cooked when bubbles start to form around the pancake. Each side should be golden brown once it's cooked all the way.

steps.title: Scoop the pancake out and place it on a plate once it has cooked all the way.
steps.content: Scoop the pancake out and place it on a plate once it has cooked all the way. Continue cooking with the remaining batter until the bowl is empty.

steps.title: Place the pancakes on a plate and leave to cool.
steps.content: Place the pancakes on a plate and leave to cool. Add maple syrup, peanut butter, etc. to them.
